intro: Isatis macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-seeded woad, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and broad, lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Its showy yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the late spring to early summer. Isatis macrocarpa is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
